books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Robert Sheckley
books.summary: A collection of science fiction and fantasy stories by Robert Sheckley ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Journals
books.author: Alexander Mackenzie
books.summary: Explorer Alexander Mackenzie details his journeys to both the Arctic and Pacific Oceans in his personal journals.

books.title: The Autobiography of Benjamin Franklin
books.author: Benjamin Franklin
books.summary: Benjamin Franklin writes about his youth, adventures, and achievements.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: Anne of Green Gables
books.author: L. M. Montgomery
books.summary: A coming-of-age story of a young girl growing up on a farm on Prince Edward Island.

books.title: The Crock of Gold
books.author: James Stephens
books.summary: A philosopher sets out to rescue the beautiful Caitilin Ni Murrachu from the god Pan in an adventure that involves leprechauns, Celtic gods, policemen, and philosophical disquisitions both profound and absurd.

books.title: The Playboy of the Western World
books.author: J. M. Synge
books.summary: A young man in the west coast of Ireland is lionized after he claims to have killed his father.

books.title: The Wood Beyond the World
books.author: William Morris
books.summary: An adventurer comes to an enchanted castle, where he must rescue a fair maiden from the clutches of an enchantress.

books.title: Savrola
books.author: Winston Churchill
books.summary: An idealistic opposition leader struggles to restrain his party while scheming to overthrow a widely-despised president and navigating a secret romance as the nation teeters toward revolution.

books.title: The Beetle
books.author: Richard Marsh
books.summary: A group of middle-class Victorians find themselves pitted against an ancient Egyptian evil.

books.title: The Interesting Narrative of the Life of Olaudah Equiano
books.author: Olaudah Equiano
books.summary: An autobiography of an ex-slave in the mid 1700s.

books.title: The Lodger
books.author: Marie Belloc Lowndes
books.summary: A maid and butler take in a mysterious, eccentric gentleman lodger around the time of the Jack the Ripper murders.

books.title: Religion and the Rise of Capitalism
books.author: R. H. Tawney
books.summary: A tracing of the development of religious thought from the Middle Ages to the dawn of the Industrial Revolution.

books.title: Discourses
books.author: Epictetus
books.summary: Epictetus instructs his students how to live the life of a Stoic.

books.title: Paradise Lost
books.author: John Milton
books.summary: A dramatic imagining in blank verse of the rebellion of Satan against God, Satan’s overthrow, and the Fall of Man.

books.title: The Coming of Bill
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A domineering author of books on eugenics and hygiene makes a match between her niece and an idle artist, intending them to raise a son according to her principles, regardless of the consequences.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Poul Anderson
books.summary: A collection of science fiction short stories by Poul Anderson ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective and his companion investigate further crimes and mysteries, culminating in a life-or-death struggle with an evil nemesis.

books.title: Tao Te Ching
books.author: Laozi
books.summary: One of the fundamental texts of the Tao philosophy and religion.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.
